physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a man standing in the middle of a sandy
 uneven beach. He is dressed only in shorts
 and is holding a coconut in his right hand. The sea can be seen in the background. The edges of the photograph are uneven. There are no tears and folds seen on the photograph.

sgcool_label_text:A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony
 this collection is part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Dr Grant, Mersing 1941
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a man standing in the middle of a sandy, uneven beach. He is dressed only in shorts, and is holding a coconut in his right hand. The sea can be seen in the background. The edges of the photograph are uneven. There are no tears and folds seen on the photograph.
metadata.context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
metadata.sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
